comment: Dra. Laval is clear from the start, she will give you the work worth while for the cost of the class. If you read the stories and go to class, you will be fine. Don't expect to do well if you don't want to read. The tests can be difficult if you don't take notes in class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Okay people, LISTEN UP! You are taking this course at KSUNIVERSITY, meaning you will no longer be spoon fed. Dra. Laval assigns a story to read/class meeting and you are expected to have read it as this is a critical reading course. If you have an idea of what happened in the story, speak up. If you speak up you will pass the class. It's that easy.
It will be nice if Dr. Laval offer extra credit assignment, only in special circumstances.

Dr. Laval is a great professor.  I was nervous to take her class after reading reviews.  She's tough and she is very frank.  Do the work and try and you will pass her class. She doesn't mince words.  She is incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter. Don't shy away from her class it's easier than you think if you just try. Fedeli was harder.
She is a very good teacher. As long as you read the stories and come to class, you will do well.

I was always told that Laval was one of the worst teachers to take at KSU. I decided to take her class anyways, and I did NOT like her at first. But I really did learn a lot in her class and she is a great teacher. She is very serious but she jokes around, and likes you if you participate in class and do the work, so suck it up and take her class!

Dr. Laval is by far one of the worse professors at Kennesaw. If she doesn't like you, she makes it VERY CLEAR & there is no way you can change it. She is very vague on everything esp. test so unless you just know ALL of the stories like the back of your hand, you are SOL. She's very tricky & it's hard to tell when she's not serious. Don't take her!

You know, all of my friends told me to never take Laval, so I never did until I had to.  I regret that now because she is a really great professor.  As long as you're interested in Spanish language and culture and you're a good student, you will get along just fine.

It's all good unless she doesn't like you. And best believe, you're gonna KNOW if she doesn't. She told a few students to change their majors a semester before graduation just because she didn't feel like they would pass her classes. Didn't offer absolutely ANY help. But you do learn a lot and you know what to expect on the tests.

Was one of the hardest teachers I have ever had. If she does not like you, she has no problem belittling you in front of everyone. Did not do well in her class, and I do not look forward to seeing her again for 3305, I read everything and took notes and still not do well on her tests.

She is a good professor, and she follows the syllabus and does not get off track. Read the book and stories, she will go over it the following class. Do the questions because she will call on you. She does not favor native speakers she favors anyone that shows interest and prepardness in class! she will discuss the stories read and make it fun.
great class, read assigned text before each class, it will help you answer questions during class and do better on her tests, nice teacher

Challenging teacher. Difficult exams. Fast-paced class, requires you to practice a loud in class. Felt left behind because my class had a number of native speakers and students with many years of Spanish, I don't know why they were allowed into an intro class, albeit with medical focus.

She is a hard teacher, she comes off very mean, but isn't so bad. She does favor native speakers VERY OBVIOSULY in class. It was like why are we here if you only  talk to the natives? Test are easy, but she's hard to follow to learn information to do good on test! Be PREPARED or she will embarrass you!
Very difficult to keep up in the class. A lot of material covered. I felt like she favored native speakers and that is who participated in the class

Spanish for Medical Professionals: Do NOT take unless you have already taken 1-2 spanish classes and it remains fresh in the mind. I felt bad for the ppl. in the class who had never taken spanish before because that was the language spoke in class!! If you speak some spanish already you should do fine if you do ALL of your work well.

Very by the book and organized (not a typical Spanish professor). Her tests are somewhat hard but classes are fun and you learn a lot. I really enjoyed her class...she seems to weed people out to enjoy a smaller class...don't let her intimidate you out...her bark is worse than her bite!
No Comments
Very hard class. She expects a lot from her students.  Avoid her like the plague.

She is a great teacher!  She lets you know what is going to be covered on her tests.  No multiple choice or True & False; every test and pop quiz she gives you is short answer and short essay.  Know your details and make sure you read the assingments

Wonderful teacher! Very funny and interesting! Lectures are clear and only cover test info; tests are not always easy, but there are NO surprises! 2 oral reports and pop quizzes were also part of the grade. Word to the wise: come to her class prepared!
